questions.questionText: You have to setup a data store using Azure Cosmos DB. The documents that would be stored in Cosmos DB would contain hundreds of properties. You need to choose a partition key that would ensure workloads are spread evenly over the partitions. Which of the following are strategies that can be implemented? answers.text: Employing a strategy of concatenation of multiple property values with a random suffix appended
Using a single property value that does not appear frequently in the documents
Using a hash suffix that is appended to a property value

Using a single property value that appears frequently in the documents

questions.explanation: You can use a concatenation of multiple property values and also use a suffix.

questions.questionText: You need to deploy a software as a service application that will run as a web service. The web service needs to be deployed using the Azure web app service. The web service will also use WebJobs to process data. There are three customers who will use the web service. Each instance of the WebJob that processes data for a single customer must run as a singleton instance. Azure costs need to be minimized. The Azure based resources must be located in an isolated network. Which of the following would you use as the underlying pricing tier for this solution?

questions.questionText: A company is developing a web site. They are planning on deploying the web site to Azure. There is a requirement to ensure that the web site remains available when it experiences high volumes of traffic. You need to minimize on cost. Which of the following would you consider from a deployment perspective?

answers.text: Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Shared service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure the virtual machine to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Standard service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure a Scale Set to increase the virtual machine instance count when the CPU load is high.

questions.explanation: Web Apps deployed to the Standard App Service Plan have the ability to scale up based on demand.

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 1?
questions.explanation: First, we have to use the 'az cosmosdb create' command to go ahead and create a Cosmos DB account.

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 2?
questions.explanation: We need to use the --capabilities option to create a Cosmos DB account with the Table API

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 3?
questions.explanation: Since the requirements mentions to cut on costs and since the application can afford to read out of order writes, we should opt for Eventual consistency

questions.questionText: Your team has an Azure storage account. You have to use the AzCopy tool to download a set of blobs from a container. Which of the following is the least privilege role that needs to be assigned to the storage account for this requirement?
questions.explanation: If you just need to download the blobs, you just need to have the Storage Blob Data Reader role.

questions.questionText: You are developing a set of Azure Functions. You have deployed a new Azure Function App. The Function App uses the underlying language runtime of .Net Core 3.1. questions.explanation: You would configure logging in the host.json file.

questions.questionText: You have to develop a solution that will make use of the Azure Service Bus service. The solution would make use of queues in an Azure Service Bus instance. The number of senders is large, and the number of receivers is less. Which of the following are best practices when it comes to maximizing the throughput for the queue? Choose 2 answers from the options given below

answers.text: If the sender resides in a different process, use multiple factories per process
If the sender resides in a different process, use a single factory per process

questions.explanation: There are different scenarios available in the Microsoft documentation when it comes to maximizing throughput for queues and topics.

questions.questionText: You have to develop an application that is going to send messages to an Azure Service Bus queue. You have to develop a module that will ensure messages sent to the queue are only moved to the Active state after a certain period of time. Which of the following would you implement to fulfil this requirement?

answers.text: Set the Lock property for the queue
Set the timeout property for the queue messages
Set the ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc property for the messages
Set the SequenceNumber property for the messages

questions.explanation: Here we need to implement scheduling of messages. This will ensure messages are sent after a certain duration of time.

questions.explanation: First, we have to use the 'az cosmosdb create' command to go ahead and create a Cosmos DB account.

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 2?
questions.explanation: We need to use the --capabilities option to create a Cosmos DB account with the Table API

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 3?
questions.explanation: Since the requirements mentions to cut on costs and since the application can afford to read out of order writes, we should opt for Eventual consistency

questions.questionText: Your team has an Azure storage account. You have to use the AzCopy tool to download a set of blobs from a container. Which of the following is the least privilege role that needs to be assigned to the storage account for this requirement?
questions.explanation: If you just need to download the blobs, you just need to have the Storage Blob Data Reader role.

questions.questionText: You are developing a set of Azure Functions. You have deployed a new Azure Function App. The Function App uses the underlying language runtime of .Net Core 3.1. You have to configure the logging level for the Azure Functions. In which of the following would you configure the logging details?
questions.explanation: You would configure logging in the host.json file.

questions.questionText: You have to develop a solution that will make use of the Azure Service Bus service. The solution would make use of queues in an Azure Service Bus instance. The number of senders is large, and the number of receivers is less. Which of the following are best practices when it comes to maximizing the throughput for the queue? Choose 2 answers from the options given below

answers.text: If the sender resides in a different process, use multiple factories per process
If the sender resides in a different process, use a single factory per process

questions.explanation: There are different scenarios available in the Microsoft documentation when it comes to maximizing throughput for queues and topics.

questions.questionText: You have to develop an application that is going to send messages to an Azure Service Bus queue. You have to develop a module that will ensure messages sent to the queue are only moved to the Active state after a certain period of time. Which of the following would you implement to fulfil this requirement?

answers.text: Set the Lock property for the queue
Set the timeout property for the queue messages
Set the ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc property for the messages
Set the SequenceNumber property for the messages

questions.explanation: Here we need to implement scheduling of messages. This will ensure messages are sent after a certain duration of time.

questions.questionText: You have to develop an application that is going to listen to events emitted by the Event Grid service. You want to ensure that your application only receives events from the virtual machine service or the devtestlab service. You have to configure the filters accordingly. Which of the following would go into Slot 1?
questions.explanation: For this requirement, we have to set Advanced filters.

questions.questionText: You have to develop an application that is going to listen to events emitted by the Event Grid service. You want to ensure that your application only receives events from the virtual machine service or the devtestlab service. You have to configure the filters accordingly. Which of the following would go into Slot 2?
questions.explanation: For this requirement, we have to set Advanced filters and filter based on the values

questions.explanation: Since you can have an out of order read for a maximum of 5 seconds, this becomes our staleness window.

questions.questionText: A company is developing a system which is going to be using Azure Cosmos DB at the underlying data store. Below are the requirements of the data store. Which of the following would go into Slot2?
questions.explanation: Since we have to ensure that the data needs to be available even in the case of network outages or any unforeseen failures, we have to enable automatic failover.

questions.questionText: A company is developing a system which is going to be using Azure Cosmos DB at the underlying data store. Below are the requirements of the data store. Which of the following would go into Slot3?
questions.explanation: Since we need to have additional regions for failover purposes, we need to add multiple locations to the Cosmos DB account.

questions.questionText: A development team is developing an application. The application will be storing its data in Azure Cosmos DB - Table API. Below are the fields that are going to be stored in the table. Which of the following will go into Slot1?
questions.explanation: Since the question states that we will be using Region to load balance the data, we have to use that as the partition key.

questions.questionText: A development team is developing an application. The application will be storing its data in Azure Cosmos DB - Table API. Below are the fields that are going to be stored in the table. Which of the following will go into Slot2?
questions.explanation: You need to have a value for the RowKey. So, if the email field has missing values for some of the entities, then we have to choose Phone as the Rowkey.

questions.questionText: A development team is developing an application. The application will be storing its data in Azure Cosmos DB - Table API. Below are the fields that are going to be stored in the table. Which of the following will go into Slot3?
questions.explanation: Since we are passing in a table parameter, and this would be a reference to our cloud table, we would need to use the CloudTable data type.

questions.questionText: A development team is developing an application. The application will be storing its data in Azure Cosmos DB - Table API. Below are the fields that are going to be stored in the table. Which of the following will go into Slot4?
questions.explanation: If we need to retrieve an entity based on the partition and row key, we will need to use the TableOperation method.

questions.questionText: A company has a web application that has been deployed using the Azure Web App service. The current service plan being used is Dl. It needs to be ensured that the application infrastructure can automatically scale when the CPU load reaches 85 percent. You also have to ensure costs are minimized. Which of the following steps would you implement to achieve the requirements? Choose 4 answers from the options given below

answers.text: Enable autoscaling on the Web application
Configure the web application to use the Standard App Service Plan
Configure the web application to use the Premium App Service Plan

questions.explanation: Since the app service plan being used is D1, that means this is the Shared Service Plan as shown below. And this plan does not have support for Autoscaling

questions.questionText: A company is planning on using the Azure CDN service to distribute static images. Below is a set of steps in a random order which would be followed by the CDN service. questions.explanation: A user requests an image from the CDN URL. The DNS routes the request to the best performing Point of Presence location

questions.questionText: A company is developing a web site. They are planning on deploying the web site to Azure. There is a requirement to ensure that the web site remains available when it experiences high volumes of traffic. You need to minimize on cost. Which of the following would you consider from a deployment perspective?

answers.text: Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Shared service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure the virtual machine to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Standard service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure a Scale Set to increase the virtual machine instance count when the CPU load is high.

questions.explanation: Web Apps deployed to the Standard App Service Plan have the ability to scale up based on demand.

Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Standard service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.

questions.questionText: A company is developing a web site. They are planning on deploying the web site to Azure. There is a requirement to ensure that the web site remains available when it experiences high volumes of traffic. You need to minimize on cost. Which of the following would you consider from a deployment perspective?

answers.text: Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Shared service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure the virtual machine to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Standard service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure a Scale Set to increase the virtual machine instance count when the CPU load is high.

questions.explanation: Web Apps deployed to the Standard App Service Plan have the ability to scale up based on demand.

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 1?
questions.explanation: First, we have to use the 'az cosmosdb create' command to go ahead and create a Cosmos DB account.

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 2?
questions.explanation: We need to use the --capabilities option to create a Cosmos DB account with the Table API

questions.questionText: You have to create an Azure Cosmos DB account that would need to use the Table API. Cost needs to be optimized for the Cosmos DB account. The application can afford to read out of order writes. You have to complete the below CLI command for the creation of the account and the table. Which of the following would go into Slot 3?
questions.explanation: Since the requirements mentions to cut on costs and since the application can afford to read out of order writes, we should opt for Eventual consistency

questions.questionText: Your team has an Azure storage account. You have to use the AzCopy tool to download a set of blobs from a container. Which of the following is the least privilege role that needs to be assigned to the storage account for this requirement?
questions.explanation: If you just need to download the blobs, you just need to have the Storage Blob Data Reader role.

questions.questionText: You are developing a set of Azure Functions. You have deployed a new Azure Function App. The Function App uses the underlying language runtime of .Net Core 3.1. You have to configure the logging level for the Azure Functions. In which of the following would you configure the logging details?
questions.explanation: You would configure logging in the host.json file.

questions.questionText: You have to develop a solution that will make use of the Azure Service Bus service. The solution would make use of queues in an Azure Service Bus instance. The number of senders is large, and the number of receivers is less. Which of the following are best practices when it comes to maximizing the throughput for the queue? Choose 2 answers from the options given below

answers.text: If the sender resides in a different process, use multiple factories per process
If the sender resides in a different process, use a single factory per process

questions.explanation: There are different scenarios available in the Microsoft documentation when it comes to maximizing throughput for queues and topics.

questions.questionText: You have to develop an application that is going to send messages to an Azure Service Bus queue. You have to develop a module that will ensure messages sent to the queue are only moved to the Active state after a certain period of time. Which of the following would you implement to fulfil this requirement?

answers.text: Set the Lock property for the queue
Set the timeout property for the queue messages
Set the ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc property for the messages
Set the SequenceNumber property for the messages

questions.explanation: Here we need to implement scheduling of messages. This will ensure messages are sent after a certain duration of time.

questions.questionText: You are developing a set of Azure Functions. You have deployed a new Azure Function App. The Function App uses the underlying language runtime of .Net Core 3.1. questions.questionText: You have to develop a solution that will make use of the Azure Service Bus service. The solution would make use of queues in an Azure Service Bus instance. The number of senders is large, and the number of receivers is less. Which of the following are best practices when it comes to maximizing the throughput for the queue? Choose 2 answers from the options given below

answers.text: If the sender resides in a different process, use multiple factories per process
If the sender resides in a different process, use a single factory per process

questions.explanation: There are different scenarios available in the Microsoft documentation when it comes to maximizing throughput for queues and topics.

questions.questionText: You have to develop an application that is going to send messages to an Azure Service Bus queue. You have to develop a module that will ensure messages sent to the queue are only moved to the Active state after a certain period of time. Which of the following would you implement to fulfil this requirement?

answers.text: Set the Lock property for the queue
Set the timeout property for the queue messages
Set the ScheduledEnqueueTimeUtc property for the messages
Set the SequenceNumber property for the messages

questions.explanation: Here we need to implement scheduling of messages. This will ensure messages are sent after a certain duration of time.

answers.text: Enable autoscaling on the Web application

questions.questionText: A company is developing a web site. They are planning on deploying the web site to Azure. There is a requirement to ensure that the web site remains available when it experiences high volumes of traffic. You need to minimize on cost. Which of the following would you consider from a deployment perspective?

answers.text: Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Shared service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure the virtual machine to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to an App Service that uses the Standard service tier. Configure the App Service plan to automatically scale when the CPU load is high.
Deploy the website to a virtual machine. Configure a Scale Set to increase the virtual machine instance count when the CPU load is high.

questions.explanation: Web Apps deployed to the Standard App Service Plan have the ability to scale up based on demand.
